reviewText: This is the best PPV of a great year at WCW. This is a well booked event in which saw the NWA push its start and ready them for the decade that would come. It saw Sting elevated to World Champ status all while showing Luger and Flair as big time players. It also pushed the new team at the time of the Steiners with a big rub with the win over the Road Warriors while keeping them strong in winning the touney. I recomend this tape strongly for wrestling and it shows how wrestling is supposed to be. Great event and would be even better if Turner Home Entertainment would have not editted some matches but that was their habit then. Great Event and one I wish the WWE with the tape rights would put together a set of. but probably wont as for many years this overshadowed Wrestlmania in many ways.

reviewText: It's been almost 20 years since the PPV took place & to this day, this is one of the most (if not THE most) unique wrestling event in the history of the professional wrestling right up there with the original Starrcade & WrestleMania.  This PPV was based off an Iron Man/Iron Team tournament based off a point system.  The idea behind the tournament is that NWA took their two top babyfaces & heels in both tag teams & singles wrestlers and had each other them face each other in 15 min. matches.  Based off how you win, you gain points and the man & team with the highest amount of points at the end of the night would win the tournament.  The point system went as follows: Pin/Submission = 20, 15 = Disqualification, Countout = 10, Draw = 5, Loss = 0.  As Jim Cornette would say throughout the night, "it's as important HOW you win as IF you win."  Basically, with this format, you would get alot of matches that were main event caliber & with the 15 min. time limit, there wasn't any time for long rest holds or stalling, you just had non-stop action.Steiner Brothers vs. Doom - This had a good mix of wrestling & with some heavy brawling towards the end but as throughout the entire tournament, Doom were just here to have the other teams to get over on & score points with.  The Steiners ended up winning by countout receiving 10 points.Sting vs. Lex Luger - I've only seen a few Sting vs. Luger matches & this was the best one I've seen them have as it was high impact between the two.  The ending was a bit exaggerated (just watch & you'll see what I mean) but again, best match I've seen between these two.  Luger wins & gains 20 points.Road Warriors vs. Doom - Similar to the Steiners match earlier as it went back & forth with the Warriors getting the 20 point victory.Ric Flair vs. Great Muta - This match was probably the shortest match Flair ever had in his NWA career as Flair & Muta went back & forth until Flair gained the upperhand.  From there was a brawl outside between the Andersons & Gary Hart's (Muta's manager) stable before Flair won with a inside cradle pin for 20 points & the end of Muta's year long undefeated streak.  Throughout the tournament, Muta would assume Doom's role as the man to put others over & score points off of.Steiner Brothers vs. Road Warriors - This match was heavily STIFF!  I mean, you could just tell that these guys were not going to go easy on each other to the point where Cornette just had to point out how stiff these guys were being.  The ending had Animal doing an offensive maneuver but had his shoulders down & actually pinned himself.  It was a good stiff match with an ending that saved both teams credibility.  Steiners gain 20 points.Sting vs. Great Muta - This followed the same formula of the Flair/Muta match as they went back & forth before Sting scored the quick pin resulting in 20 mins.  I enjoyed their Great American Bash match betterNew Wild Samoans vs. Doom - This match is heavily edited towards the end where a member of Doom & the Samoans collide & the Samoan just happened to fall on top of Doom for the 20 point win.Ric Flair vs. Lex Luger - This match is another one that's edited down towards the end where Flair had Luger in the figure four but time ran out before Lex gave up resulting in each man getting the 5 point draw.Steiner Brothers vs. New Wild Samoans - This was an average tag team match as it didn't pass the Road Warriors one but was better than the Doom match for the Steiners.  Again, it broke out into brawl at the end with Scott Steiner tossing one of the Doom members over the top rope resulting in the 15 point disqualification victory for the Samoans.Lex Luger vs. Great Muta - This match wasn't really as good as their earlier showings but Luger did a great job of selling his leg being hurt from the Flair match earlier.  Luger began gaining momentum before Muta sprayed him in the eyes leading to a 15 point disqualification victory.Road Warriors vs. New Wild Samoans - Good tag match with some brawling here & there but the Warriors pulled off the pinfall victory here giving them 20 points (40 total) to win the Iron Team tournament.Sting vs. Ric Flair - This match wasn't as classic as their later matches such as when Sting beat Flair for the World Title or their 45 min. draw at the first Clash Of Champions.  However, this match was better than the one they put on Flair's WWE DVD or their match on the last WCW Monday Nitro.  They went back & forth close to the full 15 mins. before Sting pulled out the victory in the end to gain 20 points (40 total) and win the Iron Man contest followed by the Anderson's welcoming Sting into the Four Horsemen.If you can get past some of the faulty booking such as Muta being undefeated for the entire year only to lose all his matches while Doom were being positioned as the top heel team to face the Steiners yet they lost all their matches that night, the point system made those wrestlers who the NWA saw as their top talent remained looking strong & no credibility was lost.  This to me was a 5 star event from the NWA but I only had to knock it down one due to some of the matches being edited.  Again, I recommend & get a copy of this if you can...you won't regret it.
summary: One Of The Best Starrcade's Ever!

reviewText: Starrcade, during the NWA era of WCW in the 80's, was almost always their best event! This one was the final one under the NWA banner and they at least went out with a bang!In this edition, they held two round robin tournaments for the top single and tag teams of that time in the NWA. For both, it was 20 points for a pinfall, 15 for a countout win, 10 points for a disqualification and 5 points for a draw. Any loss would result in no points and every match was only 15 minutes each!For the singles tournament, it was then-NWA TV Champion The Great Muta, then-NWA U.S. Champion Lex Luger, then-NWA Champion Ric Flair and Sting. For the tag team tournament, it was DOOM, The New Wild Samoans, The Road Warriors and then-NWA World Tag Team Champions Rick & Scott Steiner! Let's get to the action:The Steiners Vs. DOOM (Butch Reed/Ron Simmons) - Just for fun trivia, Woman (the late Nancy Benoit) managed the team of Reed & Simmons and her bodyguard was Nitron (aka a young Kevin Nash)!As for the match, it may have been the best overall tag bout of this tournament as both teams hit very stiff hits on each other. Even Rick Steiner leveled Nitron with his "steinerline" (don't laugh, if you saw his clothesline in his prime, you'd have thought his opponent was dead, he did it THAT good)!The match ends when Rick beat one of the members of DOOM back into the ring to give his team the win by countout, thus 15 points!Sting Vs. Lex Luger - Sting and Luger have had many matches together. This one was THE best I've ever seen out of them (including the one where Sting beat Lex for the WCW Title in 1992). Great effort from both men. Sting, of course, was usually great but Lex (during this period) was actually a decent performer!Anyway, it ends when Luger manages to smother Sting into a pin using the ropes for a bit of leverage. Sloppy looking finish but doesn't take way from the match (which went almost to the time limit)!The Road Warriors Vs. DOOM - These two would go onto have some hard hitting matches during 1990 when Reed and Simmons would be managed by Teddy Long. This one was pretty much a squash except for about 5 minutes when DOOM took advantage of a miscue from the late Road Warrior Hawk. Ends when Hawk hits his flying clothesline on Butch Reed (I think, remember they wore masks at this point), allowing Road Warrior Animal to get the pin."Nature Boy" Ric Flair Vs. The Great Muta w/Gary Hart (RIP) - The late Gary Hart would accompany Muta for all of his matches. Knowing this, Flair brought backup of his own in the form of Ole & Arn Anderson!The match is a quick one that saw a brawl on the outside with The Andersons holding off the late "Mad Dog" Buzz Sawyer and The Dragon Master from interfering in the match. Ends when Flair, in a smart counter, pulled up his knees as Muta tried to hit his Moonsault press! Flair quickly rolled up Muta for the win, giving him his first pinfall loss in the NWA!The Road Warriors Vs. The Steiners - In their first ever face-off, this contest had to be one of the stiffest matches I've ever seen. Its a classic though because of the stiff hits with both teams getting up for more! Ends when Hawk hits his flying clothesline again as Animal held up Scott Steiner in a back suplex position. The Road Warriors win....or so they think! Turns out Scott Steiner got his shoulder up right before the three count while Animal's were still down! The Steiner's win this one!Sting Vs. The Great Muta - A good match but don't expect their Great American Bash '89 classic. Ends when Sting hits a superplex from the middle rope, handing Muta his second pinfall in the NWA!DOOM Vs. The New Wild Samoans - The future Umaga and Rikishi would face off against an embattered team that has been getting their tails handed to them all night! I should also note that the Samoans were a last minute deal due to a legit injury to Sid Vicious, preventing him and Dan Spivey (who were the Skyscrapers) from being in the tournament.Surprisingly, DOOM dominated most of this match until The Samoan Savage (Umaga) tagged in. Ends when S.S. falls on top of Reed (with a little push from manager Sir Oliver Humperdink)! DOOM gets shut out!Ric Flair Vs. Lex Luger - Don't let the 15 minute time limit fool you as this was a real classic! Whether you see it in its entirety or in its edited form, it was awesome. Ends in a draw as Flair has Luger trapped in his figure-four but Luger refuses to submit.The Steiners Vs. The New Wild Samoans - This one was totally dominated by The Samoans except for the first 5 minutes! They beat Scott Steiner unmercifully (especially in the "family jewels") until Rick managed to get back in the match. Ends when Scott Steiner is caught throwing one of the Samoans over the top rope (which was a DQ back then)! The Samoans take this one and has a shot of taking it all!Lex Luger Vs. The Great Muta - Muta's focus was Lex's left leg as it was still hurting from his match with Ric Flair. Ends when Muta gets DQ'ed for blowing his green mist into Luger's face! Luger now is in the driver's seat to win this tourney!The Road Warriors Vs. The New Wild Samoans - This is a must win for both teams as both are in striking distance of winning. A slow match that ends when Hawk gets the win again with his flying clotheline on one of the Samoans! The Warriors win the match and the tournament as The Steiners came out afterwards to congradulate them.Ric Flair Vs. Sting - Don't expect their "Clash" match BUT it is still very good! Ends in the last 10 seconds as Sting catches him in a cradle for the pin and, as a result, he wins the Ironman Tournament!Also significant is at the end, The Andersons come to the ring seemingly to attack Sting but instead, they induct him into The Four Horsemen!Overall, this is a good card to view! In fact, nearly anything in the NWA from the 1980's is worth viewing. While they were failing financially, the action was always first rate! See this one!

reviewText: It's been 20 years since this event happened & to this day, I still regard this event as the best Starrcade event of them all. This was a really unique event as this event was center around two tournaments that would occur in one night. It was an Iron Man/Team tournament with the top wrestlers that the NWA saw as "top of the food chain". In the Iron man tournament, the participants will be NWA Champion Ric Flair, Sting, United States Champion Lex Luger & Television Champion The Great Muta. The Iron team tournament featured The Road Warriors, NWA Tag Team Champions The Steiner Brothers, Doom & New Wild Samoans who replaced the Skyscrapers due to Sid's injury. The rules were to gain points based off how you win and the man & team with the highest amount of points at the end of the night would win the tournament. The point system: 20 points for a pinfall or submission victory, 15 for a countout victory, 10 for a disqualification victory, 5 for a time-limit draw and 0 for a loss. Again, I have the original copy instead of the edited VHS release so I saw the entire card so I don't know what has been edited on the tape.The Steiner Brothers vs Doom. This was a good match that had both teams using the brawling/wrestling style throughout before the match got out of control near the end to the point where all four men were brawling on the floor till Rick Steiner made it back in the ring before the ten count to give the Steiners 15 points.Sting vs Lex Luger. Out of all their matches together including their 1992 title match, this was their best encounter as they went back & forth with Sting's fast paced/power offense meshing well with Luger's strength. The ending was sort of weak but it didn't take away from what was a great match between these two & again their best clash. Luger gets the 20 point victory.The Road Warriors vs Doom. A nice back & forth encounter between these two teams with everyone holding their own with their brawling offense before the Warriors got the 20 point victory.Ric Flair vs The Great Muta. This was Flair's shortest match in his NWA career as I think it was less than five minutes but the highlight was the wild brawl between the Horsemen & Gary Hart's stable of wrestlers. Flair wins & gets 20 points.The Steiner Brothers vs The Road Warriors. This was a dream match for me as this was the only time I can remember these two teams going at it as this was one of the stiffest matches in professional wrestling history to the point where Jim Cornette & Jim Ross (who were commentaring) pointed out how stiff both teams were being with a unique ending that allowed both teams to remain strong & nobody being effected by it. Steiners get 20 points.Sting vs The Great Muta. This didn't top their Great American Bash encounter from earlier in the year as it lacked the intensity that made their matches famous but this was still a good match with Muta using plenty of submission holds to control Sting while Sting had to fight from behind to get the 20 point victory.New Wild Samoans vs Doom. This was just an average match between these two teams as Doom seemed desperate to get a victory here before the Samoans' manager pushed one of the Samoans onto one of the Doom members to get the 20 point pinfall victory.Ric Flair vs Lex Luger. This was my favorite encounter between these two as it didn't last too long like most of their matches which lead to the action being non-stop throughout instead of both men stalling for time. The ending featured Flair locking in the figure four on Luger but the time ran out before Luger submitted which lead to both men getting the 5 point draw.The Steiner Brothers vs The New Wild Samoans. Another average match that was better for the Samoans than the Doom match but it really didn't top the Steiners/Warriors encounter with the ending coming when Scott Steiner tossed one of the Samoans over the top rope that caused a disqualification victory & 10 points for the Samoans.Lex Luger vs The Great Muta. Luger never had a great reputation as a wrestler but he did a great job of selling his injured leg from the Flair match which created nice storytelling here before Muta got disqualified for using the mist so Luger can get the 10 point victory.The Road Warriors vs The New Wild Samoans. This was an enjoyable back & forth encounter between both teams before the Warriors got the 20 point pinfall victory resulting in them gaining 40 points to win the Iron Team Tournament.Sting vs Ric Flair. This didn't top their previous Clash of the Champions classic match or even their lost Great American Bash '90 encounter where Sting won the title but they still delivered a great main event despite wrestling numerous times by this point which lead to Sting getting the upset win & gaining 20 points totalling in 40 points to win the Iron Man Tournament. The aftermath featured the Four Horsemen in Ole & Arn Anderson along with Flair welcoming Sting into the Four Horsemen.Again, this was really one of those classic wrestling cards that if you can get your hands on it, you will not regret it.

reviewText: To finish up the year WCW's 1st year I'll review the final Pay Per View of 1989 Starrcade which featured a1 night Round Robin Tournament that took The NWA World Champion Ric Flair NWA United States Champion Lex Luger Sting & the undefeated NWA Television Champion Great Muta. As well there was a Tag Team Tournament with The NWA World Tag Team Champions The Steiner Brothers DOOM The New Wild Somoans replacing The Skyscrapers due to an injury to Sid Vicous  & The Road Warriors. Now I have heard Starrcade 89 called 1 of the worst WCW Pay Per Views. Or the worst PPV ever. Really the worst did you see Starrcade 1994 or the cluster f  v  c  k known as Starrcade 1997 how about The Great American Bash 1991 or anything from 1995 both companies. The Pay Per Views from the year 2000. I got WWE PPV's from 2006 that are really bad. So back to my review for this PPV The Ironman Tournament used a points system if you won by pinfall or submission you earned 20 points. If you won by countout you won 15 points. If you won by disqualification you earned 10 points. If a match ended in a draw both wrestlers earned 5 points. None of the titles were on the line. 1st let me go over what happend since Halloween Havoc after The Thunderdome match at Terry Funk & Ric Flair agreed to wrestle in an I Quit match at Clash Of Champions IX.  Brian Pillman got another shot for The NWA US Championship. Lex Luger used a chair to retain the title while The Referee was down he used the chair a few times on on Pillman until Sting came down to make him stop he smacked Luger. Luger just walked off. Later that night Ric Flair defeated Terry Funk in The Classic I Quit match & the loser had to shake the hand of the winner Funk did as he promised he would do then Gary Hart kicked Funk's injured leg. Flair stood up for him but The Great Muta & The Dragon Master came down & attacked Flair. Sting came down out & helped Flair Flari & Sting put them in their tradematk submission holds but then Luger came out with a chair used it on Sting & helped J Tex kick the crap out of Flair. Luger then took a chair to Flair's Wrestler Of The Decade Trophy & Sting's  Most Popular Wrestler Of In The NWA Trophy destroying them Luger then went around claming that he took out the 2 top guys in The NWA in a cleen sweep. On The November 25th episode fo World Championship Wrestling Ric Flair wrestled The Great Muta where he came close in ended his undefeated streak but he got pwnd by The Dragon Master Muta & The newest edition to J Tex Buzz Sawyer. On The December 2nd episode of World Championship Wrestling Ric Flair cut a promo telling Gary Hart to be at the show next week he has a surprise for him he said that you better bring yout army with you the following week Flair had a conforntation with Gary Hart that ended up in a brawl with J Tex where Ole Anderson & a returning Arn Anderson after a year with The WWF came back to help Flair & later in the show they said that The 4 Horsemen are going to reform. Tully Blanchard was suppose to come back with Arn but in The Ric Flair & The 4 Horsmen documentary Tully said that he failded a drug test & WCW wouldn't have him. On The Novemner 18th episode of World Championship Wrestling Rick & Scott Steiner defeated The Freebirds to win The NWA World Tag Team Championship. At Clash Of The Champions IX it was announced that The Midnight Express would face The Dynamic Dudes cause of Stan Lane's dislike for Johnny Ace. Jim Cornette said he would stay home Stan Lane found in his contract that he has to be there. So in a very good heel turn Cornette hit Johnny Ace with his tennis racket & how they all acted was too funny. Also at Clash Of Champions IX Nitron aka Big Sky aka Tyller Mane aka The Worst Michael Myers debuted on behalf of Woman & Doom. So that pretty much it the buyrate was a 1.30 that's down from last years 1.80. Now I'll go over the matches.December 13, 1989Attendance6,000VenueThe OmniCityAtlanta, GeorgiaThe Steiner Brothers Rick & Scott Def Doom known as Doom 1&2 at this time with Woman & Nitron* & 3 of a quarter stars Steiners won by countout they earned 15 points the match was ok not as good as the match at Havoc though.Lex Luger Def Sting Luger put his feet on the ropes * & 3 of a quarter stars Luger earned 20 points.The match shouldn't have been so slow paced when they had 15 minutesThe Road Warriors Hawk & Animal Def Doom 0 points with Woman & Nitron * & a quarter of a star The Road Warriors earned 20 pointsRic Flair with Arn & Ole Anderson Def The Great Muta with Gary Hart * to earn 20 pointsBuzz Sawyer & The Dragon Master came down to ringside The Andersons stopped them Flair pinned Muta ending his undefeated streak. The problem I have with it was that the match was like only a couple of minutes if that it felt lackluster how the streak ended. I know Muta was leaving The NWA-WCW but if they had to end his undefeated streak they should've done it 3 weeks earlier on World Championship Wrestling seeing as that match was good.The Steiner Brothers 15 points Def The Road Warriors 20 points with Paul Ellering The Steiners earned 20 points * & half stars.It was an ok match could've been betterSting 0 points Def The Great Muta 0 points with Gary Hart * & half  starts Sting earned 20 pointsi guess if you want to call this a Great American Bash rematch go ahead his was disappointing considering at The Great American Bash that match was a good 3 star match it was face paced. Muta got buried at this event.The New Wild Somoans with Sir Oliver Humerdink Def Doom 0 points with Woman & Nitron The Somoans earned 20 points * this was as  h  i  t  t  y match & Doom was out of The Iron man Tournament.Ric Flair vs Lex Luer went the time limit ** & half stars both men earned 5 points this was a decent match finally something decent this was face paced it was a rematch from last years Starrcade Flair was looking for revenge after what he did at Clash Of Champions IX Luger has waited for a year to get his hands on Flair. It was an entertaining match not the best they had.The New Wild Somoans 20 points with Sir Oliver Humperdink  Def The Steiner Brothers 35 points by disqualification  * & a quarter of a star Rick threw 1 of the Somoans over the top rope giving 10 points to The Somoans.Lex Luger25 points Def The Great Muta with Gary Hart ** by disqualification giving Luger 10 pointsThe Great Muta was buried at this event imo. Flair gave his booking duties to Ole Anderson I think Jim Herd had something to do with it cause he didn't want Flair as The Booker anymore so Ole Anderson you're an a  s  s whole you made The Great Muta look like garbage he's suppose to be great.The Road Warriors 20 points with Paul Ellering Def The New Wild Somoans with Sir Oliver Humperdinkto earn 20 point The Road Worriors have 40 points & Hawk & Aniamal won The Iron Team Tournament.Sting Def Ric Flair *** to earn 20 points Sting had 40 points & won The Ironman TournamnetArn & Ole Anderson came down to the ring. Flair & Sting shook hands Arn & Ole raised his arms held up 4 fingers The 4 Horesemen sign Sting became a member of The 4 Horsemen.The Final Tally for The Tag Team Ironman TournamnetThe Road Warriors 40 points winnersThe Steiner Brothers 35 pointsThe New Wild Somoans 30 pointsDoom 0 pointsThe Ironman TournamnetSting 40 points winnerLuger 25 pointsFlari 25 pointsMuta 0 pointsNow as I said it was a good night for wrestling but didn't fit Starrcade being The NWA-WCW's biggest show of the year. The format was enjoyable I like watching it but it should've been done on a Clash Of Champions or a TV special on TBS or TNT. When Gordon Solie was interviewing Sting & Ric Flair the credits rolled Flair couldn't finish Sting didn't get to talk cause the Pay Per View was over. At least the feed didn't go out during the main event like Halloween Havoc 98 lol. But 1990 was set up at this event & next Wrestle War 1990 will be my next review.
summary: A good night of Wrestling that doesn't fit Starrcade 7/10
